intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. gentiliforme, commonly known as the gentiliform hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, inconspicuous florets in a compact cluster. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and often overlooked species within its range.
